page.title: 15AGRICULTURE
page.content: {Grazing}has been traditionally important but there has been a recent shift to{cereals.}Large fields dominate the northern third of the area. Some decidious woodland has gone to provide more cereal land, while miles of hedges have gone as fields are extended. The steeper sloped fields to the west and north of{Defford}have been left as {permanent grazing.}The high yielding {Friesian cow}is everywhere as the {"milk-cheque"}is still a vital part of the farmers income. {Small holdings}concentrating on{deep {litter and battery hens}are found on the edges of the main settlements as are some small remnant{orchards. Recent cuts in{EEC milk quotas}have produced drops in dairy herd numbers. {Stubble burning}after the cereal harvest remains a problem.
